lines.text: Give me all your money and your wallets.
Aw, get your ass outta here, it's too hot!

[whispering]
Richard! Richard, there's a man... in his underwear... in your kitchen.

[whispering]
It's ok. He's with me. He's my, um... my butler.
You have a butler?
Yeah, it's okay, shh... he'll go away.

[walks back from the kitchen, spots Richard and Gwen on the couch]
Oh. Oh! I didn't realize you had company. Good evening, young lady.
That's all right, Monroe. Yes, would you just go lay out my blue pinstripe for the morning?
How about if I lay you out?
Very well.
This is the note. Listen. "Richard Parker and I stole this money from the company to pay for my sex-change operation."
What?
That's what it says.
"Now he tells me he loves someone else. I can't live with that, and niether will he." It's got my name written on it!
Oh God.
Son of a bitch. I mean, it's not bad enough that he's trying to kill me. Now he's trying to turn me into a drag queen. Why couldn't he have said you were going to have the operation?
It doesn't matter, Larry, it doesn't matter.
Oh, yes it does matter, Richard, it does matter. I have a reputation to protect here!
For Christ's sake, Larry! No one is going to have a sex-change operation, huh?
Oh yeah. I've gotta call the cops!
What kind of a host invites you to his house for the weekend and dies on you?
How do you like that? The guy gets laid more times dead than I do alive.
"A little brown-nosing, a little ass-kissing, work our way up that corporate ladder?" WHY can't you be a lazy shit like I am?

[as Richard and Larry are trying to get away in Bernie's boat, Bernie's body falls into the water]
Man overboard!

[after Bernie's body flies over the balcony, looking like a high diver]
I give it an 8.3!
Richard, just tell me what is going on!

[comes down the stairs, dragging Bernie's body by the leg]
Look honey, Bernie's dead, they guys that killed 'em are now after us, can we hide out at your place or what?
[throws down Bernie's leg as he reaches the bottom of the staircase]
[eyes as big as golf balls]

[sees Gwen's horrified expression, holds up Bernie's head]
It's just Bernie!
[bangs Bernie's head against the stair support railing]

[covers her mouth quietly screaming in a high pitched squeal]
Aaaaah! Aaaah!
Gwen, we didn't do this to him!
[Gwen, mouth still covered, begins looking wildly back and forth between Richard and Larry, slowly shaking her head and backing away]
Look at us! Do we look like the kind of people who could kill someone?

[handing Gwen a drink]
Come on, honey, sit down, take a load off, have a drink, you'll be fine!
Let me rephrase that! Do *I* look like the kind of person that could kill someone?

[Paulie enters the beach house and shoots Bernie]
Company...
I didn't see anything. I was looking at my watch.

[closes eyes and waves hands]
I'm blind!
[Paulie, unconvinced, points his gun at Richard and Larry. Gwen gasps as Paulie pulls the trigger, but the chamber is empty]
It's empty.
That's right.
[opens up jacket, revealing another gun]
But this ain't!

[holds up Bernie's head]
It's just Bernie!
I have an idea!

[shouting]
What? What is it?
Lomax told whoever he was talking to not to kill us while he's around.
Yes, but Bernie's dead. He's not around anymore.
Yeah. I know that. You know that. Nobody else knows that.

[at Bernie's beach house]
Now all of this could be yours, Lar, if you set your goals and work hard.
My old man worked hard. All they did was give him more work. Ah!

[appears in a bikini]
Bernie?
[to Larry & Richard]
Hi! Is Bernie around?
Hello. No, we haven't seen him, but we just got here. We're gonna be here all weekend. We're house-guests.

[grabs the keys to Bernie's boat]
Well, tell him Tawny borrowed his boat to go skiing.
Hi, Tawny. I'm horny.
Oh, Hi. Look, don't forget to tell Bernie, okay?
Okay.
Uh, Tawny, you wouldn't happen to know where Bernie is, would ya?
Oh, he's probably making the rounds. Everybody parties from house to house, but they always end up here sooner or later. Bye!
[Tawny runs off]
And you didn't wanna come.
I was wrong. I admit it, I was wrong.
Why don't we just pretend he didn't die? Just for a bit!
God, that guy; beautiful apartment, house at the beach, babes, boat, car. Do you know how much it costs to park a car in Manhattan every month? More than my rent.
Well, I mean it's only fair. His car is a bit bigger than your apartment.
And... I lose again.
I won. Lar, I have a date.
You're kidding?
00pm, dinner!
Fabulous!
[Larry high-fives Richard]
It was the clumsy approach. It worked.
You're gonna wanna borrow my apartment.
Oh no, but thank you. That's sweet, but I can't do that to you. Thank you.
Rich, if she finds out you live with your folks, you're gonna embarrass yourself.
Yeah. Yeah, I know. But I can't do that to you, Larry.
It's the coackroaches isn't it?
Well...
They scatter when the light goes on.
Why are you shooting us? We're just friends of Bernie's.
I hate... Bernie's friends!
[keeps shooting]
[the first "killer" enters opens the front door with Richard standing behind it with a fire log]
You in here, Lomax, you little bastard?
[Richard swings, but misses when the bum turns his head]
You jerk?
[He swings again, but misses again... ]
Kick me in the ass. It's my turn now.
[... before finally whacking the bum's head, knocking him unconscious]
Got him, Lar.
[Bernie has just finished typing up the ransom note intended for Richard and Larry's "big fall"]

[chuckles]
Oh, this is good. This is very good.
[puts the note in a suitcase, then gets up and abruptly sees Paulie behind him; freaks out]
Ah! Oh, I didn't hear you come in.
I know. I'm real good at that.
I told ya the guys aren't here yet, did I?

[nods head]
It's quite a shack you got here.
Well, it's home.
Ooh, can I have a cigarette?
Hmm?
Cigarette.

[last words]
Sure. Sure, sure, sure, sure.
[Bernie bends over to get the cigarettes, but Paulie injects a fatal overdose of heroin in his buttocks]
Ow! Oh, what was th -
[succumbs to the heroin]
Ooh! Ooh, ooh, oooh.
[Bernie slumps back into his desk chair, now dead. Paulie releases the needle from his buttocks]
Quite a ride, huh, Bern?

[at the office on a hot Sunday]
Let's go to the beach.
No.
We're gonna be here our whole lives.
Yeah, I'm afraid so.

[grabs Richard's papers]
I'm going to the beach.
What are you doing-What are you doing? Gimme those papers.
These papers are going to the beach!
We are not going to the beach.
Want these? They're coming to the beach.

[mumbles]
Yes, we're going to the beach.
Wilson at the five! Oh, that was beautiful! Replay!
[Richard chases Larry, who runs for the elevator]

[yells]
Gimme those papers!

[on the rooftop of Larry's father's apartment]
You think it's safe to go in the water?
Nah, better not. You just ate. You might get cramps.
I'll risk it.

[Richard and Larry are in Bernie's living room discussing what they should do about the body. A buxomy blonde enters from the patio wearing a thong bikini and sunglasses]
Hi, guys! I'm Tawny! Bernie said I could borrow his boat for the day; I've come to get the keys.
Hi Tawny! I'm horny!
Well, you're a half hour late.
Only half hour? I'm usually forty-five minutes late. I'm early today.
This is good for me.
Hot enough for ya, Larry?
No, Harris! Why don't you turn up the heat?
OK, I'll tell the engineer.
We could call the cops, Richard, but you know where we'd be spending our weekend. In some... goddamned hot police station answering questions we don't know the answers to.
[Richard and Larry are trying to back Bernie's speedboat out of it's dock space and crash into several other boats]
That's illegal! What you're doing is illegal!
Bernie is waiting for us!
Look, Bernie isn't going anywhere!

Paddling... In the Atlantic Ocean... On a dead body. This is now the perfect weekend. It started when I almost broke my leg jumping on a moving ferry. I get to this beautiful beech and my host... Sorry! He's dead! I fell down a lighthouse. I had a corpse wash up next to me on the shore. I then I find out that my dead boss? He's not only a thief; he wants to kill me! I almost drown. The girl of my dreams now thinks I'm a raving lunatic. And now we're going back to the house of death.
Great weekend, huh?
Great weekend!
